title: Lawsuit Settlement Funding Firm Reports Bronx Livery Cab Crash involving Off-Duty Uber Driver, 8 Year Old Girl Left Critically Injured
text:
Legal-Bay LLC
Lawsuit Cash Advance Firm says that the recent incident occurred when the off-duty Uber driver lost control of the car and jumped the sidewalk, injuring a woman and four children who were waiting for a school bus.
YONKERS, N.Y. , Oct. 5, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Legal-Bay LLC, The Lawsuit Settlement Funding Company, reports today that a recent car and pedestrian accident occurred in the Bronx last week when an off-duty Uber driver lost control of his vehicle and jumped the curb, injuring a woman and four children who were on the sidewalk waiting for a school bus. The woman involved had minor injuries, but she was with her two children, her 5 year old son, and her 8 year old daughter. The 8 year old girl was critically injured, according to the NY Daily News, with major head trauma, broken legs, and a broken pelvis. The other two children involved, a 7 year old girl and 11 year old boy, were also on the sidewalk and struck by the black livery cab. According to the article, the other children suffered broken bones. The driver of the cab, an off-duty Uber driver, was driving a 2014 black Toyota Camry, and according to the NY Daily News article, he told police he lost control of the vehicle before jumping the curb. The driver has not been charged, however, he has been suspended and an investigation is underway.
